com.here.mobility.sdk.map

Class MapController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.mobility.sdk.map.MapController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer

    public class MapController
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer
    MapController is the main class for interacting with a Tangram map.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MapController.CameraType
      Options for changing the appearance of 3D geometry
      static class  MapController.CompassVisibility
      Options for compass visibility.
      static class  MapController.EaseType
      Options for interpolating map parameters
      static interface  MapController.FeaturePickListener
      Interface for a callback to receive information about features picked from the map Triggered after a call of MapController.pickFeature(float, float) Listener should be set with MapController.setFeaturePickListener(FeaturePickListener) The callback will be run on the main (UI) thread.
      static interface  MapController.FrameCaptureCallback
      Callback for MapController.captureFrame(FrameCaptureCallback, boolean)
      static interface  MapController.LabelPickListener
      Interface for a callback to receive information about labels picked from the map Triggered after a call of MapController.pickLabel(float, float) Listener should be set with MapController.setLabelPickListener(LabelPickListener) The callback will be run on the main (UI) thread.
      static interface  MapController.MarkerPickListener
      Interface for a callback to receive the picked Marker Triggered after a call of MapController.pickMarker(float, float) Listener should be set with MapController.setMarkerPickListener(MarkerPickListener) The callback will be run on the main (UI) thread.
      static interface  MapController.SceneLoadListener
      Interface for listening to scene load status information.
      static interface  MapController.ViewCompleteListener
      Called on the UI thread at the end of whenever the view is stationary, fully loaded, and no animations are running.

      void pickFeature(float posX, float posY)
      Query the map for geometry features at the given screen coordinates; results will be returned in a callback to the object set by MapController.setFeaturePickListener(FeaturePickListener)
      void pickLabel(float posX, float posY)
      Query the map for labeled features at the given screen coordinates; results will be returned in a callback to the object set by MapController.setLabelPickListener(LabelPickListener)
      void pickMarker(float posX, float posY)
      Query the map for a Marker at the given screen coordinates; results will be returned in a callback to the object set by MapController.setMarkerPickListener(MarkerPickListener)

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_EASE_TYPE

        protected static final MapController.EaseType DEFAULT_EASE_TYPE

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapController

        protected MapController(MapView view)
        Construct a MapController using a custom scene file
        Parameters:
        view - The view displaying the map; input events from this view will be handled by the MapController's TouchInput gesture detector. It also provides the Context in which the map will function; the asset bundle for this activity must contain all the local files that the map will need.

    • Method Detail

      • captureFrame

        public void captureFrame(MapController.FrameCaptureCallback callback,
                         boolean waitForCompleteView)
        Capture MapView as Bitmap.
        Parameters:
        waitForCompleteView - Delay the capture until the view is fully loaded and no ease- or label-animation is running.

      • loadSceneFile

        public int loadSceneFile(java.lang.String path)
        Load a new scene file synchronously. Use MapController.setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        Returns:
        Scene ID An identifier for the scene being loaded, the same value will be passed to MapController.SceneLoadListener.onSceneReady(int sceneId, SceneError sceneError) when loading is complete.

      • loadSceneFileAsync

        public int loadSceneFileAsync(java.lang.String path)
        Load a new scene file asynchronously. Use MapController.setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        Returns:
        Scene ID An identifier for the scene being loaded, the same value will be passed to MapController.SceneLoadListener.onSceneReady(int sceneId, SceneError sceneError) when loading is complete.

      • loadSceneFile

        public int loadSceneFile(java.lang.String path,
                         java.util.List<com.here.mobility.sdk.map.SceneUpdate> sceneUpdates)
        Load a new scene file synchronously. If scene updates triggers an error, they won't be applied. Use MapController.setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        sceneUpdates - List of SceneUpdate
        Returns:
        Scene ID An identifier for the scene being loaded, the same value will be passed to MapController.SceneLoadListener.onSceneReady(int sceneId, SceneError sceneError) when loading is complete.

      • loadSceneFileAsync

        public int loadSceneFileAsync(java.lang.String path,
                              java.util.List<com.here.mobility.sdk.map.SceneUpdate> sceneUpdates)
        Load a new scene file asynchronously. If scene updates triggers an error, they won't be applied. Use MapController.setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        sceneUpdates - List of SceneUpdate
        Returns:
        Scene ID An identifier for the scene being loaded, the same value will be passed to MapController.SceneLoadListener.onSceneReady(int sceneId, SceneError sceneError) when loading is complete.

      • updateSceneAsync

        public int updateSceneAsync(java.util.List<com.here.mobility.sdk.map.SceneUpdate> sceneUpdates)
        Apply SceneUpdates to the current scene asyncronously If a updates trigger an error, scene updates won't be applied. Use MapController.setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        sceneUpdates - List of SceneUpdate
        Returns:
        new scene ID

        duration - Time in milliseconds to ease to the given position

        public void showBoundingBox(@NonNull
                            GeoBox box,
                            @Nullable
                            android.graphics.Rect padding)
        Set the position and zoom of the map such that the given bounding box is visible. The target view can be further restricted with padding values.

      • showBoundingBoxEased

        public void showBoundingBoxEased(@NonNull
                                 GeoBox box,
                                 @Nullable
                                 android.graphics.Rect padding,
                                 int duration)
        Like MapController.showBoundingBox(GeoBox, Rect), but with an animation of the given length, in milliseconds.

      • showBoundingBoxEased

                                 GeoBox box,
                                 @Nullable
                                 android.graphics.Rect padding,
                                 int duration,
                                 MapController.EaseType ease)
        Like MapController.showBoundingBox(GeoBox, Rect), but with an animation of the given type and length, in milliseconds.

        public void setMaxTilt(float maxTilt)

        Parameters:
        maxTilt - angle in radians; 0 corresponds to straight down

      • screenPositionToLatLng

        @Nullable
public LatLng screenPositionToLatLng(android.graphics.PointF screenPosition)
        Find the geographic coordinates corresponding to the given position on screen
        Parameters:
        screenPosition - Position in pixels from the top-left corner of the map area
        Returns:
        LatLng corresponding to the given point, or null if the screen position does not intersect a geographic location (this can happen at high tilt angles).

      • screenPositionToLatLng

        @Nullable
public LatLng screenPositionToLatLng(float x,
                                               float y)
        Find the geographic coordinates corresponding to the given position on screen
        Parameters:
        x - Position on the X axis, in pixels from the top-left corner of the map area
        y - Position on the Y axis, in pixels from the top-left corner of the map area
        Returns:
        LatLng corresponding to the given point, or null if the screen position does not intersect a geographic location (this can happen at high tilt angles).

      • latLngToScreenPosition

        public android.graphics.PointF latLngToScreenPosition(LatLng location)
        Find the position on screen corresponding to the given geographic coordinates
        Parameters:
        location - Geographic coordinates
        Returns:
        Position in pixels from the top-left corner of the map area (the point may not lie within the viewable screen area)

      • addDataLayer

        public MapData addDataLayer(java.lang.String name)
        Construct a collection of drawable map features.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the data collection. Once added to a map, features from this MapData will be available from a data source with this name, just like a data source specified in a scene file. You cannot create more than one data source with the same name. If you call addDataLayer with the same name more than once, the same MapData object will be returned.

      • addDataLayer

        public MapData addDataLayer(java.lang.String name,
                            boolean generateCentroid)
        Construct a collection of drawable map features.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the data collection. Once added to a map, features from this
        generateCentroid - boolean to control label centroid generation for polygon geometry MapData will be available from a data source with this name, just like a data source specified in a scene file. You cannot create more than one data source with the same name. If you call addDataLayer with the same name more than once, the same MapData object will be returned.

        Parameters:

        public void setSimultaneousGestureAllowed(com.here.mobility.sdk.map.TouchInput.Gestures first,
                                          com.here.mobility.sdk.map.TouchInput.Gestures second,
                                          boolean allowed)
        Set whether the gesture second can be recognized while first is in progress
        Parameters:
        first - Initial gesture type
        second - Subsequent gesture type
        allowed - True if second should be recognized, else false

      • setPickRadius

        public void setPickRadius(float radius)
        Set the radius to use when picking features on the map. The default radius is 0.5 dp.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius in dp (density-independent pixels).

      • pickFeature

        public void pickFeature(float posX,
                        float posY)
        Query the map for geometry features at the given screen coordinates; results will be returned in a callback to the object set by MapController.setFeaturePickListener(FeaturePickListener)
        Parameters:
        posX - The horizontal screen coordinate
        posY - The vertical screen coordinate

      • pickLabel

        public void pickLabel(float posX,
                      float posY)

        Parameters:
        posX - The horizontal screen coordinate
        posY - The vertical screen coordinate

        public void pickMarker(float posX,
                       float posY)

        Parameters:
        posX - The horizontal screen coordinate
        posY - The vertical screen coordinate

      • addMarker

        public Marker addMarker()
        Adds a Marker to the map which can be used to dynamically add points and polylines to the map.
        Returns:
        Newly created Marker object.

      • addPolyline

        public long addPolyline(PolylineOverlay polyline)
        Adds a PolylineOverlay to the map. The styling of the polyline is the default one.
        Returns:
        an id with which the polyline can later be removed via MapController.removePolyline(long).

      • removePolyline

        public boolean removePolyline(long id)
        Removes a polyline with the given id.
        Returns:
        whether a feature with the given id actually existed (and was removed).

      • removeMarker

        public boolean removeMarker(Marker marker)
        Removes the passed in Marker from the map.
        Parameters:
        marker - to remove from the map.
        Returns:
        whether or not the marker was removed

      • removeAllMarkers

        public void removeAllMarkers()
        Remove all the Marker objects from the map.

      • setViewCompleteListener

        public void setViewCompleteListener(MapController.ViewCompleteListener listener)
        Set a listener for view complete events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The MapController.ViewCompleteListener to call when the view is complete

      • getOverlaysParent

        public android.widget.RelativeLayout getOverlaysParent()
        Returns the map's overlay layout, into which various statically-positioned views can be added.

      • setDefaultBackgroundColor

        public void setDefaultBackgroundColor(float red,
                                      float green,
                                      float blue)
        Sets an opaque background color used as default color when a scene is being loaded.
        Parameters:
        red - red component of the background color - a value between 0 and 1.0
        green - green component of the background color - a value between 0 and 1.0
        blue - blue component of the background color - a value between 0 and 1.0

      • getUserLocationMarkerManager

        public UserLocationMarkerManager getUserLocationMarkerManager()
        Returns the manager of the user location marker.

      • setCompassVisibility

        public void setCompassVisibility(@NonNull
                                 MapController.CompassVisibility compassVisibility)
        Sets the visibility mode of the compass. The options are:
        • MapController.CompassVisibility.VISIBLE_ALWAYS - the compass is always visible
        • MapController.CompassVisibility.HIDDEN_ALWAYS - the compass is never visible
        • MapController.CompassVisibility.VISIBLE_WHEN_MAP_ROTATED - the compass is visible only when the rotation of the map is not 0

      • setCompassView

        public void setCompassView(@LayoutRes
                           int layoutResId)
        Sets a custom CompassView. This layout root element of the layout must be an instance of CompassView. It will be added into the overlays parent, which is a RelativeLayout. Use a value of 0 to reset to the default compass view.

      • setCompassView

        public void setCompassView(@Nullable
                           CompassView compassView)
        Sets a custom compass view. Pass a null value to reset to the default one.
